metadata.title: CVE-2024-42307 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:cifs: fix potential null pointer use in destroy_workqueue in init_cifserror pathDan Carpenter reported a Smack static checker warning:   fs/smb/client/cifsfs.c:1981 init_cifs()   error: we previously assumed 'serverclose_wq' could be null (see line1895)The patch which introduced the serverclose workqueue used the wrongoredering in error paths in init_cifs() for freeing it on errors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42307` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
